senses.de: Having a thin edge or point that can cut or pierce something
senses.ex: He cut the apple with a sharp knife.

Tips.title: Physical Sharpness
Tips.description: Used literally to describe objects that can cut or pierce. Be careful when using items described as 'sharp'.
Tips.example: She accidentally pricked her finger on a sharp needle.

Tips.title: Mental Acuity
Tips.description: Refers to quick intelligence. 'Sharp' in this sense often compliments someone's mental capacity.
Tips.example: His sharp wit always brightened our conversations.

Tips.title: Sudden Change
Tips.description: Indicates an immediate or abrupt change in direction or condition, often unexpectedly.
Tips.example: There was a sharp decline in temperatures overnight.

senses.de: Having a strong, often unpleasant taste or smell
senses.ex: The lemon has a sharp taste.

Tips.title: Intense Flavor
Tips.description: Describes a taste or smell that is strong and distinct, not necessarily unpleasant.
Tips.example: The cheese left a sharp aftertaste in my mouth.

senses.de: In music, higher in pitch by one half step
senses.ex: The note was a bit sharp.

Tips.title: Pitch Precision
Tips.description: In music, 'sharp' means slightly above the intended pitch. It's specific to musical context.
Tips.example: Try not to sing the chorus too sharp.

senses.ex: He has a sharp sense of style.

Tips.title: Visual Clarity
Tips.description: Emphasizes the clearness and distinct appearance of an image or style.
Tips.example: The photographer is known for his sharp images.

senses.ex: I will meet you at 8 o'clock sharp.

Tips.title: Punctuality
Tips.description: Means exactly at the specified time, emphasizing timeliness. Common in everyday use.
Tips.example: The bus leaves at 9:00 AM sharp, so don't be late.

senses.de: A musical note that is one semitone higher than a given note

Tips.title: Musical Notation
Tips.description: A symbol in music that means to play/sing slightly higher in pitch. Always related to music sheets.
Tips.example: The score indicates that you should play a C sharp here.

Acute.wordDefinition: Acute generally describes a condition or situation that is intense and severe, such as an "acute illness" or "acute pain." Sharp describes something that is physically pointed, like a "sharp knife" or mentally precise, like a "sharp wit." Acute describes intense and severe conditions or situations, while sharp describes something that is physically pointed or mentally precise.

Astute.wordDefinition:
Astute means having a keen insight or understanding, while sharp means having a quick or clever intellect or perception.

Astute is more applicable when talking about someone who can accurately and quickly analyze a situation or problem, and use their knowledge to make wise decisions.

For example, a business person might be described as astute if they make smart decisions about investments or negotiations.

Astute is more about analyzing and understanding, while sharp is more about being clever and quick-witted.

Bite.wordDefinition:
Bite refers to the action of using your teeth to grab and press down on something, such as when you eat an apple or a sandwich.

Bite describes the action of your teeth, while sharp describes the physical shape or quality of something.

Incisive.wordDefinition:
Incisive means having a keen ability to understand and analyze something, while the word sharp generally refers to physical objects that are well-defined or pointed.

For example, if someone has an "incisive mind," it suggests that they are able to understand complex ideas or situations with clarity and precision.

Incisive is more commonly applied to mental or intellectual skills, while sharp is often used to describe physical attributes.

Keen.wordDefinition:
Both keen and sharp describe attributes of something being precise or focused, but they are used in slightly different situations.

Keen is often used to describe someone's interest or enthusiasm for something. For example, someone might be keen on playing video games or keen to learn a new skill.

Keen often describes enthusiasm, while sharp describes physical precision.

Pierce.wordDefinition:
Pierce means to make a hole in something by pushing or thrusting a pointed object through it.

Sharp means having a thin edge or point that can easily cut or pierce through something. It is commonly used to describe knives, needles, or other objects with an edge or point that can easily cut or penetrate skin.

Pierce means to make a hole by thrusting something through it, while sharp describes an object with a thin, pointed edge that can easily cut or penetrate.

Point.wordDefinition:
Point refers to the tip of an object, such as a pencil or a needle.

It can also refer to a specific location or moment, such as "the point in time when the concert started."

Point typically refers to the tip or specific location of an object, while sharp typically refers to an edge or angle that is able to cut or a precise measurement or observation.

Shrewd.wordDefinition:
Shrewd typically refers to a person who is astute, clever and good at judging situations, especially in business or financial matters.

To summarize, being sharp means having a general intelligence and quick reflexes, while being shrewd means having good judgement and practical skills, especially in dealing with finances and business.

quotes.Text: Lily's really together - she's a sharp kid and one of the smartest human beings I have ever met. Whatever she is doing, if she needs any advice, I'm there for her. Kids are going to make their own decisions, but I guess that the only thing you can do as a parent is to offer support. And I do.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Johnny Depp

quotes.Text: For my money, if I'm playing anything then it has to have some sharp angles on it. It's got to have some edges that you can cut yourself on, otherwise it's boring.
quotes.Title: Australian Actor
quotes.Name: Grant Bowler

quotes.Text: We all make worse decisions when we are tired but being fit keeps your mind sharp and gives you the confidence to handle anything the world throws at you.
quotes.Title: English Athlete
quotes.Name: Jos Buttler

quotes.Text: I'm an owner that tends to absolutely be supportive of a coach and his vision if it's a real sharp and smart vision. I really believe in that.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jeffrey Lurie

quotes.Text: I know quite a few friends who are models, and they're usually really smart, sharp, world-savvy people.
quotes.Title: Canadian Actress
quotes.Name: Hannah Simone

quotes.Text: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
quotes.Title: British Philosopher
quotes.Name: Bertrand Russell

quotes.Text: The important thing is always to be sharp and score when the opportunity arises.
quotes.Title: Dutch Athlete
quotes.Name: Klaas-Jan Huntelaar

quotes.Text: It's important to collect unusual characters. It keeps you sharp.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Billy Gibbons

quotes.Text: I said in sharp language that that practice was wrong.
quotes.Title: American Lawyer
quotes.Name: Ken Starr

quotes.Text: Pain is life - the sharper, the more evidence of life.
quotes.Title: English Critic
quotes.Name: Charles Lamb
